page.title: 04BALLYNAHATTY
page.content: Ballynahatty today is no more than a most pleasant,quiet and extremely rural townland.Yet it could have been a busy urban community,the county town of Tyrone if planners in the 1740's had had their way. Omagh had been burned to the ground for the second time and people of wealth and influence wanted the new town to be sited at Ballynahatty. It is easy to see why.The area contains several high points making it easily defensible.There is a river affording a supply of water which is easily fordable or bridged. The land in the area,especially to the east and north provides better farming facilities.
